messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: It doesn't work okay, in the sense that it doesn't split things into sensible-sized chunks
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:17): though it does still split things into chunks
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:17): but I'll just need to upload the new version which has a new list of split ids
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:17): which is hopefully trivial
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:17): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/ is the new version
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:17): i'm ready to flip the switch and check it in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:18): just give the word
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:19): Hmph, you've done too much work and now the sections are unevenly sized again
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:19): heh
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:20): Did anyone conclude whether the lxml parser/serialiser has problems, that would mean I couldn't use them in the spec-splitter?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:20): the serialiser has issues iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:21): though i forget what
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:21): the parser is already used by anolis so whatever problems it introduces are already payed for
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:21): looks ok to me, though we need to fix some Anolis bugs too in due course
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:22): but I thought the service from b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea was not stable?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:22): (Hmm, better sizes now - the largest is 261KB for the forms section)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:22): not stable?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:23): http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20081001#l-33
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:24): will stick with the html5lib serialiser, just to be safe
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:25): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: seems wise
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:25): and time is not an issue with the multipage script

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:25): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: well, i have my system set up so it will fire up every anolis instance i know if (james' and yours so far) and use whichever one gets back soonest
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:25): i know of, even
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:26): But it slows down my server and steals CPU time away from its more important processes such as, er, irssi and not much else

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:29): Updated the spec-splitter service now
